title: Ticket #1000: Provide alternative to Standard Universe
description:
Motivation/Why:
  • Cost of maintenance of existing solution
  • Expense of creating new ports
  • Fragility based on level of integration of solution
  • ...

Approach:

  • Identify features provided by the Standard Universe - [DONE]
    1. Checkpointing of re-linked executables
    2. Remote system calls for re-linked executables
    3. Checkpoint storage by Schedd or CkptServer
  • Identify alternatives to current checkpoint technology - [DONE: DMTCP]
    • CGroups Freezer
      • Pros: no re-linking, kernel supported
      • Cons: maturity, availability in kernel
    • BLCR
      • Pros: no re-linking, handles mpi
      • Cons: availability in kernel, custom mpi libraries
    • DMTCP
      • Pros: no re-linking, handles mpi, relationship with authors
      • Cons: user level does not handle all processes uniformly, deeper knowledge required
  • Identify alternative to current system call technology
    • Parrot
      • Pros: no re-linking, technology understood, relationship with authors
      • Cons:
    • Chirp
      • Pros: no re-linking, technology understood, relationship with authors
      • Cons: filesystem replacement only
  • Identify alternatives to current storage technology
    • NONE?
  • Develop knowledge and understanding of DMTCP - #23
    • Issues identified:
      • DMTCP carried as part of job or compiled on execute side? Why?
      • How to manage DMTCP job specific files?
      • How to provide debugging assistance to user?
  • Integrate DMTCP into test suite, provide coverage for checkpoint tests - #366
  • Provide DMTCP as checkpoint alternative to Standard Universe
    • Integrate into Vanilla Universe
      • Shim scripts? (submit side integration, e.g. LD_PRELOAD etc)
      • Topping? (execute side integration, e.g. prepare hook rewrites job)
  • Open questions:
    • What is the cost of maintaining DMTCP support? How robust to glibc, kernel changes?
    • How is transition support provided? Is there a release containing both? How many?
    • What are the predominant use cases for Standard Universe? Are all features needed?
      • e.g. LIGO is large user, cares about checkpointing and filesystem access via shared filesystem (no remote syscalls)
    • What documentation needs to change, or be written?
